intro: Ouratea wrightii, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet, with opposite, simple, and usually lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in panicles and are often used in floral arrangements due to their delicate appearance. The plant prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
